body: × Rate the Lesson Plan             Lesson Plan Climate Change in Vermont: Measuring Predicted Impacts    Download Lesson Plan         carbon cycle         Overall Rating  Add your review      Grade Level: Seventh Grade-Eleventh Grade Subject: Agriculture, Biology: Plants, Climate Change, Hydrology, Mathematics, Meteorology, Science and Technology, Statistics   Keywords: maple sugaring, phenology    Overview In the "Emerging Science" episode (VT Public Television) “Climate Change: A Northeast Primer,” students are introduced to present-day and potential future impacts of climate change on Vermont. Through these activities, students plan ways to measure climate change, explore climate change data, and use phenology to detect a species’ response to climate change.           Lesson Plans  Exploring Climate Science: Climate Change   Investigating Bird Migration and Climate Change   Considering Climate Change: Fire Island and Storms    Distance Learning  Climate Connections - Climate Science in Focus   Climate Connections   Internet Citizen Science Databases     Field Trips  Climate Science in Focus Field Trip   Adobe Engineering Challenge   Do History and Science at the                Tsongas Industrial History Center    Topics  The Liberty Bell as a Modern Symbol, grades K-2   A Soldier's Notes From Michigan's Big Battle   John Smith's Masterpiece and Copyright Nightmare
title: Marsh - Billings - Rockefeller National Historical Park: Climate Change In Vermont Lesson Plan
